content.question: The second paragraph of the excerpt makes which of the following claims about the populations of men and women in the colonies?

choices.label: New England settlers included more young men than Chesapeake settlers did.
Emigrants to New England were predominantly unmarried women.
The populations of men and women in New England were roughly equal from the time of its founding.
The population of the Chesapeake achieved a balanced sex ratio more quickly than New England did.

content.answer: The populations of men and women in New England were roughly equal from the time of its founding.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and describe a claim and/or argument in a text-based or non-text-based source.
